thread.title: Kleyo De Abreu dies from bungee jump in Spain
thread.title_full: Kleyo De Abreu dies from bungee jump in Spain

title: Kleyo De Abreu dies from bungee jump in Spain
text:
THE family of a 23-year-old woman who crashed to her death in a bungled bungee jump has been left in shock, desperate for an explanation.
Kleyo De Abreu made the almost 80m jump from the Tablate Bridge, a popular bungee spot in southern Spain, attached to what should have been a secure rope.
The British tourist’s lifeless body was left dangling for 25 minutes after crashing into a stone structure below, the Mirror reports . She was killed instantly.
Tablate Bridge in Granada, Spain, is a popular bungee jumping spot. Source: Getty Images
A Spanish judge will investigate the circumstances surrounding Ms De Abreu’s death which police have said was likely caused by “a miscalculation involving the rope”.
The London woman had been on the trip of a lifetime, visiting her aunts and cousins in southern Spain after travelling in Morocco.
The drop is around 80m. Source: Getty Images
Kleyo De Abreu died instantly when she hit a stone column. Source: Facebook
Her family said she had planned to study fashion design in London when she returned.
The London woman’s grieving father, Bernard Atwell, has said the family is “shell shocked and in disbelief” after losing his daughter. He described her as adventurous, kind, honest and genuine.
As Guardia police continue their investigation, Ms De Abreu’s family has expressed their frustration, saying the information they have received is “all very vague”.
The 23-year-old had planned to return to her studies after travelling. Source: Facebook
“I’ve been young before and ridden motorbikes fast and done parachute jumps for charity. It’s all fun but there has to be things put in place for safety to stop what our family is going through at this point in time,” Mr Atwell told the Mirror .
“But what I will say is, if someone dies bungee jumping then obviously something wasn’t in place. Something was amiss.”
